intro: Phacelia stellaris, commonly known as starry phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Phacelia stellaris is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to attract pollinators and improve soil quality.
